intro: Silene zawadzkii, commonly known as the Zawadzki's campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pinkish-white flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine pubescence, aiding in water retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Silene zawadzkii is considered a species of conservation concern.
